meanings.definition: To bake (something) partially before finishing it off
meanings.sent1: I will prebake the cake before adding the frosting.
meanings.sent2: It is best to prebake the pie crust before adding the filling.
meanings.sent3: Why don't we prebake the cookies a little to make them extra crispy?
meanings.sent4: She decided to prebake the bread to speed up the baking process.
meanings.sent5: Prebaking the pizza crust ensures it will be perfectly crispy.

meanings.sent1: The prebake bread smelled delicious as it finished baking.
meanings.sent2: The prebake cookies were golden brown and ready to eat.
meanings.sent3: The prebake pizza was a hit at the party, everyone loved it.
meanings.sent4: I prefer prebake muffins because they are always moist and fluffy.
meanings.sent5: The prebake cake had a lovely texture and taste.

meanings.definition: The act of partially baking something before finishing it
meanings.sent1: The prebake of the bread saved time in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She learned the importance of a prebake when making pastries.
meanings.sent3: The prebake of the pie crust made all the difference in the final dish.
meanings.sent4: A quick prebake can enhance the flavors of certain dishes.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret was a prebake to achieve the perfect texture.
